blog.description: I libri sono stati i miei uccelli e i miei nidi, i miei animali domestici, la mia stalla e la mia campagna; la libreria era il mondo chiuso in uno specchio; di uno specchio aveva la profondità infinita, la varietà, l’imprevedibilità.

blog.name: secretlyatargaryen
blog.title: Worms are crawling in and out of Rhaegar's ass
blog.description: Jenny. This blog consists mainly of Game of Thrones/A Song of Ice and Fire, with particular focus on Tyrion, but also among my favorites are Sansa, Cersei, Arya, and Brienne. I also occasionally post about video games or books or whatever else I find interesting.

summary: I think the most you could accuse Tyrion of when he offers Lancel to Sansa is trying to make himself feel better about his...
body: I think the most you could accuse Tyrion of when he offers Lancel to Sansa is trying to make himself feel better about his eventual rape of her, and yes, that’s awful, but he’s doing this because he’s forced into this situation and it’s rape for him, too, and he’s trying to come up with rationalizations to cope with his own abuse as well as hers, not because he really wants to rape her and wants to give himself permission. Of course those rationizations are problematic but they aren’t coming from entitlement, they are coming from a place where he’s trying to cope with a situation that is extremely sexually traumatizing for him, too. And it shows a pretty obvious callousness towards victims (some of whom develop unhealthy coping mechanisms and rationalize what happened to them) and refusal to understand how sexual abuse works to use Tyrion offering Lancel as some kind of proof that he is in any way complicit in what’s happening.

reblog.comment: I think the most you could accuse Tyrion of when he offers Lancel to Sansa is trying to make himself feel better about his eventual rape of her, and yes, that’s awful, but he’s doing this because he’s forced into this situation and it’s rape for him, too, and he’s trying to come up with rationalizations to cope with his own abuse as well as hers, not because he really wants to rape her and wants to give himself permission. Of course those rationizations are problematic but they aren’t coming from entitlement, they are coming from a place where he’s trying to cope with a situation that is extremely sexually traumatizing for him, too. And it shows a pretty obvious callousness towards victims (some of whom develop unhealthy coping mechanisms and rationalize what happened to them) and refusal to understand how sexual abuse works to use Tyrion offering Lancel as some kind of proof that he is in any way complicit in what’s happening.

trail.content_raw: I think the most you could accuse Tyrion of when he offers Lancel to Sansa is trying to make himself feel better about his eventual rape of her, and yes, that’s awful, but he’s doing this because he’s forced into this situation and it’s rape for him, too, and he’s trying to come up with rationalizations to cope with his own abuse as well as hers, not because he really wants to rape her and wants to give himself permission. Of course those rationizations are problematic but they aren’t coming from entitlement, they are coming from a place where he’s trying to cope with a situation that is extremely sexually traumatizing for him, too. And it shows a pretty obvious callousness towards victims (some of whom develop unhealthy coping mechanisms and rationalize what happened to them) and refusal to understand how sexual abuse works to use Tyrion offering Lancel as some kind of proof that he is in any way complicit in what’s happening.
trail.content: I think the most you could accuse Tyrion of when he offers Lancel to Sansa is trying to make himself feel better about his eventual rape of her, and yes, that’s awful, but he’s doing this because he’s forced into this situation and it’s rape for him, too, and he’s trying to come up with rationalizations to cope with his own abuse as well as hers, not because he really wants to rape her and wants to give himself permission. Of course those rationizations are problematic but they aren’t coming from entitlement, they are coming from a place where he’s trying to cope with a situation that is extremely sexually traumatizing for him, too. And it shows a pretty obvious callousness towards victims (some of whom develop unhealthy coping mechanisms and rationalize what happened to them) and refusal to understand how sexual abuse works to use Tyrion offering Lancel as some kind of proof that he is in any way complicit in what’s happening.

summary: I know people have defended it
title: I know people have defended it
body:
but just short and succinct notes on why I ship Jonsa:

- they work as a -team-
- they exude ‘comfort’ rather than ‘passion’/’lust’, or some ~opposites attract~ basic attraction
- before you try to school me on ‘incest’ or their ‘brother/sister’ relationship, I have a brother, and trust me, Jon is NOT acting like a brother (those stares? handholding?? forehead kiss??! If Robb did it to Sansa, I will be (just being honest here) repulsed.) I am against incest in real life, very much so. 

- Jon/Sansa is not Jaime/Cersei, they’re stronger parallels to Jaime/Brienne

- Bryan Cogman, you know, writer/producer, already stated that Jon and Sansa viewed each other as non-siblings when they were young, they weren’t close, hence they don’t have the familiarity/bond brothers and sisters have. Come on, so many posts have already dissected this to the letter. Plus, Jon is her cousin, which is allowable in medieval times/Game of Thrones. I mean, Tywin Lannister was head over heels over his cousin/wife/mom of Cersei, Jaime and (??) Tyrion

- wolf bits, chokeholds, redheads + princes

- as a writer, the romantic structure (or stealthy lack of) D&D are using to build them up. Lots of lies and deceit going on around here, very GoT like

- George RR Martin’s original outline, which has protagonist Jon falling in love with a girl he thought was his sister (previously named Arya), cue internal strife and anguish, then relief when they find out they’re just cousins. (compare to the Jon/D*ny strife of omg-I-banged-a-girl-who-I’m-actually-related-to-god-damn) 

THINGS that I think will NOT happen:

- No Jonsa wedding, because of the dire situation Westeros is in. Night King, Targaryen restoration/three-way-war - they won’t have the luxury of grand weddings. We might get Jon pledging his loyalty to the North, maybe some romantic dialogue scenes, but no wedding.

- I also think they won’t have a sex scene anytime soon. I mean, season 7 hardly had one (except a couple, and a major one, like…boatbang lol). The way things are getting hectic, I don’t think they’re going to include one. Maybe hint at it, I dunno. 


At the rate things are going, I actually think no one’s going to have some sexy time soon. War, dragons, dragon zombies, etc.  But hey, if Jon and D*ny found time on a boat…well, people can be resourceful.

That ends my rant. Peace out.

summary:
Chapter 9 | Lady's Slippers
        |
        Minnesota, State Of...
title:
Chapter 9 | Lady's Slippers
        |
        Minnesota, State Of...
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
“We weren’t close, any of us. My parents didn’t raise us that way. Mom was the one who put me in hockey, but that was more to get me out of the house. My older brother was already in a pretty bad crowd. Most I can remember, it was drugs and guns and whatever else. He got himself killed before I even made it to juniors.”

“I’m so sorry,” Sansa muttered, laying a hand on his arm. Sandor tangled their fingers up absentmindedly, still talking.

“Nah, it wasn’t a loss. He was a vicious asshole. He did this to me, you know,” Sandor informed her, in the same tone as someone might ask after the weather. With a sinking pit of horror in her stomach, Sansa looked again at the skin on his face, off colored and scarred.

“He – he – how?” She stammered, unable to comprehend the violence Sandor had faced. He was watching her calmly, like he was evaluating how she reacted to the story.

“We were playing as kids. I had a toy, an old Gretsky figurine. Pretending to be the great one, you know? Like every damn kid in Canada back then and my brother was already way too old to give a shit about hockey players. But he thought it was his. We had an old, shitty radiator in that house, and so he just grabbed me and held me to it. They got hot back then, hot enough to burn, and then….” Sandor trailed off, but Sansa’s shock remained. She’s figured his scar had came from some accident he wasn’t ready to disclose. She’d never imagined it would be anything like this.

blog.name: thefeatherofhope
blog.title: Littlefeather
blog.description:
It's about what you believe. 
And I believe in love 💗

summary:
“What a clever daughter you are.”
 It was clever. The tourney, the prizes, the winged knights, it had all been her own notion....
body:
“What a clever daughter you are.”

 It was clever. The tourney, the prizes, the winged knights, it had all been her own notion. Lord Robert’s mother had filled him full of fears, but he always took courage from the tales she read him of Ser Artys Arryn, the Winged Knight of legend, founder of his line. 

Why not surround him with Winged Knights?  She had thought one night, after Sweetrobin had finally drifted off to sleep. His own Kingsguard, to keep him safe and make him brave. And no sooner did she tell Petyr her idea than he went out and made it happen.

Excerpt from the Winds of Winter | George R.R. Martin
